com.redhat.rhn.frontend.struts

Class RequestContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.frontend.struts.RequestContext

  • public class RequestContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for accessing various objects in the scope of a request. The objects are created by looking at request parameters for their ID's and then retrieving them from the appropriate manager.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RequestContext.Pagination
      Names of pagination elements (and their corresponding attributes).

      • getRequest

        Returns:
        the current request

        Returns:
        the currently LOGged in user that is making the request.

      • getUserFromUIDParameter

        public User getUserFromUIDParameter()
        Get the user on the request based on the "uid" paramter. Used when editing Users other than the LOGged in user.
        Returns:
        User found.

      • lookupErratum

        public Errata lookupErratum()
                     throws BadParameterException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the erratum with the ID given by the request's ERRATA_IDparameter
        Returns:
        the erratum with the ID given by the request's ERRATA_IDparameter
        Throws:
        BadParameterException - if the request does not contain the required parameter, or if the parameter can not be converted to a Long
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no erratum with the ID given in the request can be found

      • lookupServer

                    throws BadParameterException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        the server with the ID given by the request's SID parameter
        Throws:
        BadParameterException - if the request does not contain the required parameter, or if the parameter can not be converted to a Long
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no server with the ID given in the request can be found

      • lookupAndBindServer

        public Server lookupAndBindServer()
                           throws BadParameterException,
                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the server with the ID given by the request's SID parameter. Puts the server in the request attributes.
        Returns:
        the server with the ID given by the request's SID parameter
        Throws:
        BadParameterException - if the request does not contain the required parameter, or if the parameter can not be converted to a Long
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no server with the ID given in the request can be found

        public ActivationKey lookupAndBindActivationKey()

        Throws:
        BadParameterException - if the request does not contain the required parameter, or if the parameter can not be converted to a Long

        public KickstartData lookupAndBindKickstartData()

        Returns:
        the KickstartDatay with the ID given by the request's KICKSTART_ID parameter
        Throws:

      • getParam

        public java.lang.String getParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                        boolean required)
        Get the parameter paramName from the request. If required is true, this method will never return null; instead, it will throw a BadParameterException if the parameter is not in the request. If required is false, the return value can be null.
        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the parameter
        required - whether this parameter must be present
        Returns:
        the parameter value or null if not required.

      • hasParam

        public boolean hasParam(java.lang.String name)
        Get whether a parameter is present in the request.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        Returns:
        True if the named parameter is in the request.

      • getParamAsLong

        public java.lang.Long getParamAsLong(java.lang.String param)
        Returns the value of the parameter named param of the request as a Long. This method will trim the String as well to check for "" and " ". If the String is "1234 " it will return a Long with value: 1234. If the String is "" and required is true it will treat it like a null value and throw BadParameterException.
        Parameters:
        param - Name of request parameter to be converted.
        Returns:
        the value of the parameter named param of the request as a Long. null if the parameter is blank.
        Throws:
        BadParameterException - if the parameter param can not be converted to a Long

      • getRequiredParam

        public java.lang.Long getRequiredParam(java.lang.String paramName)
        Get the parameter paramName from the request and convert it to a Long. A BadParameterException is thrown if the parameter is not present in the request or can not be converted.
        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        the parameter value converted to a Long

      • getRequiredParamAsString

        public java.lang.String getRequiredParamAsString(java.lang.String paramName)
        Get the parameter paramName from the request A BadParameterException is thrown if the parameter is not present in the request or is empty
        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        the parameter value converted to a Long

      • getRequiredParamAsLong

        public java.lang.Long getRequiredParamAsLong(java.lang.String paramName)
        Get the parameter paramName from the request A BadParameterException is thrown if the parameter is not present in the request or is empty
        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        the parameter value converted to a Long

      • isRequestedExport

        public boolean isRequestedExport()
        If this current Request includes a parameter to indicate the User is attempting to produce an export of viewable data then return true. Only for use with the Old list tag's exporter. The new list tag doesn't use "lde" as a parameter, it uses lde_unique(listName).
        Returns:
        if this request includes an export param

      • getWebSession

        public WebSession getWebSession()
        Retrieves the currently Logged in user's pxt session. If it doesn't exist, a new session is created.
        Returns:
        The currently Logged in user's pxt session. If it doesn't exist, a new session is created.

      • processPagination

        public java.lang.String processPagination()
        Get the value for the lowest part of the list to display. This is protected so that the setup actions can get this value for redirecting the request.
        Returns:
        the lowest value to display.

      • makeParamMapWithPagination

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> makeParamMapWithPagination()
        Creates a hashmap with pagination vars added.
        Returns:
        Returns a new hashmap containing the parameters

      • buildPageLink

        public java.lang.String buildPageLink(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String value)
        Take a HttpServletRequest and build a self-link to the requested page and include a name/value parameter. Won't re-append the parameter if adding it is re-attempted.
        Parameters:
        name - of parameter to add
        value - value of paramter
        Returns:
        url that is built.

      • copyParamToAttributes

        public void copyParamToAttributes(java.lang.String paramId)
        Copies an attached parameter to the attributes list This is useful when we want to propagate a parameter that was passed to us, like sid
        Parameters:
        paramId - the param to copy

      • wasDispatched

        public boolean wasDispatched(java.lang.String messageKey)
        Examines a submit action of the name "dispatch" with the i18n'ed value of the key passed in. This is useful for example in the following scenario.. Lets say you have the following html input Lets suppose 'copy.to.local' was the message key you'd pass to localizationService if i18n'ing... Lets suppose the en_US value of copy.to.local = Copy To Local When the button is submitted, IE will submit "dispatch=Copy To Local" This means in the submit action we need to i18n the button value again when doing a lookup... This method is supposed to help there.. One can just do if (requestContext.wasDispatched("copy.to.local")) Alternatively one can also extend RhnLookupDispatchAction to achieve the same.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - the message key to be i18ned.
        Returns:
        true if a "dispatch" parameter was set and that equaled the i18ned value of the message key

      • isJavaScriptEnabled

        public boolean isJavaScriptEnabled()
        Returns if javascript is enabled/not in this page. This needs to be used in conjuction with rhn noscript taglib.. If you need to use this method add the following line to your jsp after the form, so that it gets submitted
        Returns:
        true if java script is enabled, false other wise.

      • isSubmitted

        public boolean isSubmitted()
        Simple util to check if the Form on a page was submitted This needs to be used in conjuction with rhn submitted taglib.. If you need to use this method add the following line to your jsp after the form, so that it gets submitted
        Returns:
        true if the form was submitted, false other wise

      • requirePost

        public void requirePost()
        verify that the request is a POST and throw an exception otherwise.
